message.content: This question requires an understanding of how animals respond to cold temperatures. When the air is cold, animals like sheep will often shake or shiver in order to generate body heat and keep themselves warm. Option (A) is incorrect because sleeping would not generate enough heat to keep the sheep warm in the cold air. Option (C) and (D) are also incorrect because jumping and running would actually cool the sheep down even more instead of keeping them warm.

Option (C) and (D) are also incorrect as jumping and running would not be effective ways for the sheep to stay warm in the cold air.

Cold air causes animals, including sheep, to shiver or shake in order to generate heat and maintain their body temperature. Therefore, option (B) is the most appropriate answer.
